PRIVATE EVENTS AND DINING

Download PDF >

https://detroitldv.com/menu

6/7

Address: 322 S Main St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Dimly lit, swanky establishment providing gourmet desserts & pastries, cocktails & a cigar lounge.

summary.snippet: "This place surprised me with the quality of the service and the food."
"Be warned that there will be people smoking cigars."

most_relevant.description: Such a cool spot in Downtown AA! A little pricey but because it's attached to the Chop House. Our server Aya was amazing! You have to go through the Chop House doors and the greeters will take you to the cigar area. If you are gluten free they have Crème brûlée and sorbet and Gelato.

Delicious variety of desserts. My favorite was the banana pudding. Really warm center with an outstanding flavour. I would say my second favorite was the creme brulee. Nice amount of sugar at the top and rich vanilla flavour.
We got the bananas foster bread pudding and mudslide cheesecake and it was delicious. Great treat on a special night. Our server, Maria, was a delight and very knowledgeable about the menu.
Downstairs is so intimate and relaxing. The lights are low, the chairs and couches are comfortable. And the desserts are stunning! Great date place!

My husband and I came here after dinner for something sweet and this place did not disappoint! I had the candy bar pie and he had the German chocolate cake - both were delicious. Beautiful presentation. The service was good and the atmosphere was cozy and romantic. I would definitely recommend coming here for a sweet treat!

My husband and I just went in for dessert to go. We had seen the desserts online, and that’s what drew us to the restaurant.  The restaurant was busy, and after taking our order, they could’ve easily just thrown our items together and sent us on our way. But from the host, to the bar staff, to the ambiance, to the dessert preparation, everything was beautiful and absolutely delicious.

The desert was great! I ordered a chocolate decadence. I like to make fancy deserts at home and it was awesome to see different mousses and a ganache come together with a fudgey brownie. The textures were varied from fluffy to dense - and I loved it! I wish there was a more substantial fruit pairing (I think they used to serve this desert with a blackberry sorbet, but now it is just a berry coulis) because the flavors mixed so well. The atmosphere and the seating are also part of the experience. I came early and had my choice of couch, which had a nice view of the fireplace. The only thing that took away from the atmosphere was the manager was talking down to the wait staff right beside me for some time during my visit.

Great desserts, great drinks. Open later for the night owls. The staff is very attentive and kind. There is also a great cigar lounge in the basement. The wife always gets the Spanish coffee. Try the bananas foster, its unbelievable. There are always weekly rotating different cookie flavors that are unbelievable.
